result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Libby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs due during probation period. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

-Defendant to submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

*Probation and jail term may be transferred to Milwaukee, if accepted.

**Pursuant to hearing held 11/25/2015; Defendant to pay $4500 restitution directly to victim Ataco Steel. The amount of $3413.22 has been paid directly to victim to date.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William R Libby

District Attorney's office notified clerk that defendant has paid victim restitution in full. Clerk notified DOC.
Entry made on JOC to include restitution amount and the payments to be made directly to the victim.
Clerk verified that defendant has made direct restitution payments to victim in the amount of $3413.22. As of today, balance due is $1086.78 directly to victim.

Defendant William R Libby in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Representatives of Ataco Steel present in court. Insurance company to pay $14,900 to the victim and defendant responsible to pay $4500. The defendant will pay victim $3000 from an account he has and thereafter pay balance of restitution in payments commencing the first day of the month until paid in full. Defendant to make monthly payments directly to the victim, Ataco Steel.
Restitution hearing at 11-25-2015 10:30 am

Defendant William R Libby in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  8:40 am   Detective Michael Buechler sworn and continues testimony. Crossexam by Atty. Poulson, redirect by Atty. Gerol.
  8:48 am   State rests.
  8:49 am   Jury excused.
  8:50 am   Defense moves for dismissal. Court denies motion. Court examines defendant as to his right to testify.
  8:57 am   W. L. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Poulson, crossexam by Atty. Gerol, redirect, recross.
  9:20 am   P. G. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Poulson, crossexam by Atty. Gerol, redirect.
  9:30 am   R. B. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Poulson, crossexam by Atty. Gerol, redirect. 
  9:40 am   Defense rests.
  9:41 am   Detective Michael Buechler resumes stand for rebuttal testimony. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Poulson.
  9:44 am   Jury recess. Court/counsel jury instruction conference.  Counsel stipulate to allow extra juror deliberate.
10:22 am   Closing statement by Atty. Gerol.
10:36 am   Closing statement by Atty. Poulson.
10:45 am   Rebuttal statement by Atty. Gerol.
10:53 am   Court instructs jury.
11:10 am   Bailiff sworn.
11:11 am   Jury leaves for deliberation.
11:40 am   Court/counsel in session-jury question. Discussion between Court/counsel. Court will permit #3, #4, #11 exhibit to be given to jury.
11:45 am   Jury in Court. Court statement to jury. Jury leaves for deliberation.
12:08 pm   Court is informed a verdict has been reached. Court/counsel/jury in Court. 
                    Verdict read by Court: Guilty  Answer to question: Yes
12:10 pm   Jury thanked and excused.
                    Court schedules sentencing for 8/20/2015 at 2:30 pm. Defendant given firearm restriction, bail to continue.
